Key Arguments: Truth should emerge from free speech and the free flow of information.
Government and bureaucrats should not decide what is true, as they may have ulterior motives.
Control of information is historically linked to deception and manipulation.
Cites examples of government misinformation, such as asbestos dangers and COVID-19 responses.
Believes the legislation is part of a global trend towards censorship.
Argues that government censorship should be limited to harmful content like child pornography.
Main Themes: Distrust of government and global organizations
Opposition to censorship in political, scientific, and medical discourse
Notable Quotes: Truth will sort itself out with a free flow of information and freedom of speech.
Nothing good has ever come from control of information.
Save the censorship for kiddy porn where it may do some good, and leave the subjects of politics, science, medicine, and religion out of it.
